sen.j: 比叡山（ひえいざん）とは、滋賀県大津市西部と京都府京都市北東部にまたがる山。
sen.e: Mt. Hiei is a mountain that straddles the western part of Otsu City in Shiga Prefecture and the northeastern part of the city of Kyoto.
Mt. Hiei is a mountain that straddles the western part of Otsu City in Shiga Prefecture and the northeastern part of Kyoto City in Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 原文に京都府とあるので、in Kyoto Prefectureを末尾に補足。
sen.e: Mt. Hiei is a mountain that straddles the western part of Otsu City in Shiga Prefecture and the northeastern part of Kyoto City in Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 大津市と京都市左京区の県境に位置する大比叡（848.3m）と左京区に位置する四明岳（しめいがたけ、838m）の二峰から成る双耳峰の総称である。
sen.e: Mt. Hiei is the name for the Souji ridge, which is formed by two peaks: Daihiei (848.3m) on the border between Otsu City and Kyoto City's Sakyo Ward; and Shimeigatake in Sakyo Ward (838m).
Mt. Hiei is the name for the Souji ridge, which is formed by two peaks: Daihiei (848.3m) on the border between Otsu City and Kyoto City's Sakyo Ward; and Shimeigatake in Sakyo Ward (838m).
Mt. Hiei is the name for the Soji ridge, which is formed by two peaks: Daihiei (848.3m) on the border between Otsu City and Kyoto City's Sakyo Ward; and Shimeigatake in Sakyo Ward (838m).

sen.j: 大比叡の一等三角点は大津市に所在する。
sen.e: Daihiei's first-order triangulation point is located in Otsu City.
Daihiei's first-order triangulation point is located in Otsu City.
Daihiei's first-order triangulation point is located in Otsu City.

sen.j: 高野山と並び古くより信仰対象の山とされ、延暦寺や日吉大社があり繁栄した。
sen.e: Next to Mt. Koya, it has long been an object of religious belief, floursishing with Enryaku-ji Temple and Hiyoshi Taisha Shrine on it.
Next to Mt. Koya, it has long been an object of religious belief, floursishing with Enryaku-ji Temple and Hiyoshi Taisha Shrine on it.
Next to Mt. Koya, it has long been an object of religious belief, flourishing with Enryaku-ji Temple and Hiyoshi Taisha Shrine on it.

sen.j: 東山 (京都府)に含まれる。
sen.e: It is part of the Higashiyama mountains (Kyoto Prefecture).
It is part of the Higashiyama mountains (Kyoto Prefecture).
It is part of the Higashiyama mountains (Kyoto Prefecture).

sen.j: 別称は叡山、北嶺、天台山、都富士など。
sen.e: It is also known as Eizan, Hokurei, Tendaisan, Miyakofuji, etc.
It is also known as Eizan, Hokurei, Tendaisan, Miyakofuji, etc.
It is also known as Eizan, Hokurei, Tendaisan, Miyakofuji, etc.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Overview
Overview
Overview

sen.j: 京都の鬼門にあたる北東に位置することもあり、比叡山は王城鎮護の山とされた。
sen.e: Because of its location near the Kimon gate on the northeast side of Kyoto, Mt. Hiei is considered a castle guardian.
Because of its location near the Kimon gate on the northeast side of Kyoto, Mt. Hiei is considered a castle guardian.
Because of its location near the Kimon gate on the northeast side of Kyoto, Mt. Hiei is considered a castle guardian.

sen.j: 古事記では比叡山は日枝山（ひえのやま）と表記され、大山咋神が近江国の日枝山に鎮座し、鳴鏑を神体とすると記されている。
sen.e: The Kojiki calls M. Hiei 'Hieyama', and records that Oyamakui no kami is enshrined on Hieyama in Omi Province, and Narikabura is the body of the god.
The Kojiki (Records of Ancient Matters) calls Mt. Hiei 'Hienoyama', and records that Oyamakui no kami is enshrined on Hienoyama in Omi Province, and Narikabura is the object of worship.
sen.cmt: Kojikiのアンダーラインを外し、括弧内に意味を補足。 M. Hiei→Mt. Hiei Hieyama→Hienoyama (ご)神体→an object of worship
sen.e: The Kojiki (Records of Ancient Matters) calls Mt. Hiei 'Hienoyama', and records that Oyamakui no kami is enshrined on Hienoyama in Omi Province, and Narikabura is the object of worship.

sen.j: 延暦寺が日枝山に開かれて以降、大山咋神は地主神として天台宗・延暦寺の守護神とされ、大山咋神に対する山王信仰が広まった。
sen.e: Ever since Enryaku-ji Temple was founded on Hieyama, Oyamakui no kami, as the god of the land, has been a guardian deity of the Tendai Sect and Enryaku-ji; and a mountain-king sect based on him has spread in the area.

Ever since Enryaku-ji Temple was founded on Hienoyama, Oyamakui no kami, as the god of the land, has been a guardian deity of the Tendai Sect and Enryaku-ji Temple; and a mountain-king sect based on him has spread in the area.

Ever since Enryaku-ji Temple was founded on Hienoyama, Oyamakui no kami, as the god of the land, has been a guardian deity of the Tendai Sect and Enryaku-ji Temple; and a mountain-king sect based on him has spread in the area.

sen.j: また比叡山山頂の諸堂や山麓の日吉大社などを参拝して歩く延暦寺千日回峰行も行われ信仰の山である。
sen.e: Also, it is the mountain where Enryaku-ji Temple's Thousand-Day Circumambulation is done, including pilgrimage to the shrines at the peak of Mt. Hiei, and to Hiyoshi Taisha at its foot.

Also, it is the mountain where Enryaku-ji Temple's Thousand-Day Circumambulation Practice is done, including a pilgrimage to the shrines at the peak of Mt. Hiei, and to Hiyoshi Taisha Shrine at its foot.
sen.cmt: Circumambulation→CircumambulationPractice pilgrimage→a pilgrimage Hiyoshi Taisha→Hiyoshi Taisha Shrine
sen.e: Also, it is the mountain where Enryaku-ji Temple's Thousand-Day Circumambulation Practice is done, including a pilgrimage to the shrines at the peak of Mt. Hiei, and to Hiyoshi Taisha Shrine at its foot.

sen.j: 登山も盛んで、代表的な登山口としては京都市左京区修学院から登る雲母坂、滋賀県側の門前町・坂本 (大津市)から無動寺谷を通って登る登山道などがある。
sen.e: Hiking is popular, and a famous trail begins at Shugakuin in Kyoto's Sakyo Ward and goes up Kirarazaka hill; another one on the Shiga Prefecture side begins in Monzenmachi, Sakamoto (Otsu City), and goes up through Mudojidani valley.

Hiking is popular, and a famous trail begins at Shugakuin in Sakyo Ward of Kyoto City and goes up Kirarazaka hill; another one on the Shiga Prefecture side begins in Monzenmachi, Sakamoto (Otsu City), and goes up through Mudojidani valley.
sen.cmt: Kyoto's Sakyo Ward→Sakyo Ward of Kyoto City 自然な表現に訂正。
sen.e: Hiking is popular, and a famous trail begins at Shugakuin in Sakyo Ward of Kyoto City and goes up Kirarazaka hill; another one on the Shiga Prefecture side begins in Monzenmachi, Sakamoto (Otsu City), and goes up through Mudojidani valley.

sen.j: 雲母坂は古くから京都と延暦寺を往復する僧侶・僧兵や朝廷の勅使が通った道であり、現在も登山客は多い。
sen.e: The path on Kirarazaka hill has long been used by monks and imperial messengers traveling between Kyoto and Enryaku-ji, and is still visited by many hikers today.
The path on Kirarazaka hill has long been used by monks, monk soldiers and imperial messengers traveling between Kyoto and Enryaku-ji Temple, and is still visited by many hikers today.
sen.cmt: 僧兵→monk soldiersを補足。 Enryaku-ji→Enryaku-ji Temple
sen.e: The path on Kirarazaka hill has long been used by monks, monk soldiers and imperial messengers traveling between Kyoto and Enryaku-ji Temple, and is still visited by many hikers today.

sen.j: 山内には大津から京都大原方面へ抜ける東海自然歩道が通っている。
sen.e: The Tokaido Nature Trail passes through the mountain on the way from Otsu to Kyoto/Ohara.
The Tokaido Nature Trail passes through the mountain on the way from Otsu to Kyoto/Ohara.
The Tokaido Nature Trail passes through the mountain on the way from Otsu to Kyoto/Ohara.

sen.j: 有料道路やケーブルカー、ロープウェイで山頂まで行けるため、休日には観光客が多く訪れる。
sen.e: Many tourists come on holidays, since they can reach the top via toll road, cable car, and ropeway.
Many tourists come on holidays, since they can reach the top via toll road, cable car, and ropeway.
Many tourists come on holidays, since they can reach the top via toll road, cable car, and ropeway.

sen.j: かつては比叡山頂遊園地と比叡山人工スキー場があったが2002年までにすべて閉鎖され、スキー場の跡地はコスモス園、山頂遊園地の跡地は美術館「ガーデンミュージアム比叡」になっている。
sen.e: There used to be a Mt. Hiei Amusement Park and a Mt. Hiei Artificial Ski Slope, but both were closed before 2002; the site of the ski slope is now a cosmos flower garden, and there is an art museum - Hiei Garden Museum - on the former location of the amusement park.

There used to be a Mt. Hiei Amusement Park and a Mt. Hiei Artificial Ski Slope, but both were closed before 2002; the site of the ski slope is now a cosmos flower garden, and there is an art museum - Hiei Garden Museum - on the former location of the amusement park.

There used to be a Mt. Hiei Amusement Park and a Mt. Hiei Artificial Ski Slope, but both were closed before 2002; the site of the ski slope is now a cosmos flower garden, and there is an art museum - Hiei Garden Museum - on the former location of the amusement park.

sen.j: また、京都側のふもとの八瀬には森のゆうえんち（森のゆうえんち）もあったが、こちらも2001年11月30日に閉鎖され、跡地には会員制リゾートホテルが建った。
sen.e: There was also a Forest Land Amusement Park at the foot of the hill on the Kyoto side, although that was closed on November 30, 2001, and a members-only resort hotel now stands in that location.

There was also a Forest Land Amusement Park in Yase, at the foot of the mountain on the Kyoto side, although that was closed on November 30, 2001, and a members-only resort hotel now stands in that location.
sen.cmt: in Yaseを補足。 at the foot of the hill→at the foot of the mountain ※原文に森のゆうえんちという言葉が二度繰り返されている。
sen.e: There was also a Forest Land Amusement Park in Yase, at the foot of the mountain on the Kyoto side, although that was closed on November 30, 2001, and a members-only resort hotel now stands in that location.

sen.j: 大比叡と四明岳
sen.e: Daihiei and Shimeigatake
Daihiei and Shimeigatake
Daihiei and Shimeigatake

sen.j: 国土地理院による測量成果では、東の頂を大比叡、西の頂を四明岳、総称として比叡山としている。
sen.e: The survey findings from the Geographical Survey Institute show the eastern peak as Daihiei, the western peak as Shimeigatake, and both of them together as Mt. Hiei.
The survey findings from the Geographical Survey Institute show the eastern peak as Daihiei, the western peak as Shimeigatake, and both of them together as Mt. Hiei.
The survey findings from the Geographical Survey Institute show the eastern peak as Daihiei, the western peak as Shimeigatake, and both of them together as Mt. Hiei.

sen.j: 「点の記」では、東の頂に所在する一等三角点の点名を「比叡山」としている。
sen.e: As a triangulation point, the first-order triangulation point on the eastern peak is called "Mt. Hiei".
According to "Ten no Ki" (The Record of Survey), the first-order triangulation point on the eastern peak is called "Mt. Hiei".
sen.cmt: 原文にある、「点の記」に忠実に訳しました。
sen.e: According to "Ten no Ki" (The Record of Survey), the first-order triangulation point on the eastern peak is called "Mt. Hiei".

sen.j: この三角点は大津市と京都市の境に位置するが、所在地としては大津市にあたる。
sen.e: Although this marker is located at the border between Otsu and Kyoto cities, it is inside Otsu City.
Although this marker is located at the border between Otsu and Kyoto cities, it is inside Otsu City.
Although this marker is located at the border between Otsu and Kyoto cities, it is inside Otsu City.

sen.j: 京都盆地から比叡山を見た場合、大比叡の頂を確認することが難しく、四明岳を比叡山の山頂だと見なすことがある。
sen.e: When one views Mt. Hiei from the Kyoto basin, it is difficult to see the Daihiei peak, so some think that Shimeigatake is the peak of Mt. Hiei.
When one views Mt. Hiei from the Kyoto basin, it is difficult to see the Daihiei peak, so some think that Shimeigatake is the peak of Mt. Hiei.
When one views Mt. Hiei from the Kyoto basin, it is difficult to see the Daihiei peak, so some think that Shimeigatake is the peak of Mt. Hiei.

sen.j: 京福電気鉄道叡山ロープウェイにおいては、四明岳の山頂をもって比叡山頂駅と設定している。
sen.e: The Keifuku Electric Railroad Eizan Ropeway has its Hiei Mountaintop Station placed on the Shimeigatake peak.
The Keifuku Electric Railroad Eizan Ropeway has its Hiei Mountaintop Station placed on the Shimeigatake peak.
The Keifuku Electric Railroad Eizan Ropeway has its Hiei Mountaintop Station placed on the Shimeigatake peak.

sen.j: 四明岳の表記、あるいは読みには多数の説があり、国土地理院による「四明岳（しめいがたけ、しめいだけ）」のほか、「京都市の地名」では「四明ヶ岳（しめがたけ）」、「四明峰（しみょうのみね）」などを挙げている。
sen.e: There are conflicting opinions as to the proper way to write and read "Shimeigatake"; the GSI lists Shimeigatake/Shimeidake, while Place Names of Kyoto lists Shimegatake and Shimyo no Mine.
There are conflicting opinions as to the proper way to write and read "Shimeigatake"; the GSI lists Shimeigatake/Shimeidake, while "Place Names of Kyoto" lists Shimegatake and Shimyo no Mine.
sen.cmt: アンダーラインを外して、"Place Names of Kyoto"としました。
sen.e: There are conflicting opinions as to the proper way to write and read "Shimeigatake"; the GSI lists Shimeigatake/Shimeidake, while "Place Names of Kyoto" lists Shimeigatake and Shimyo no Mine.

sen.j: 比叡山の別称である天台山、ならびに四明岳の名称は、天台宗ゆかりの霊山である中華人民共和国の天台山、四明山に由来する。
sen.e: Mt. Hiei gets its alternate names, Mt. Tendai and Shimeigatake, from Mt. Tiantai and Mt. Siming, mountains in the People's Republic of China that have associations with the Tendai Sect.
Mt. Hiei gets its alternate names, Mt. Tendai and Shimeigatake, from Mt. Tiantai and Mt. Siming, sacred mountains in the People's Republic of China that have associations with the Tendai Sect.
Mt. Hiei gets its alternate names, Mt. Tendai and Shimeigatake, from Mt. Tiantai and Mt. Siming, sacred mountains in the People's Republic of China that have associations with the Tendai Sect.

sen.e: Geography
Geography
Geography

sen.e: Mt. Hiei Viewed from the Side (left side)
Mt. Hiei Viewed from the Side (left side)
Mt. Hiei Viewed from the Side (left side)

sen.j: 丹波高地ならびに比良山地とは花折断層を境にして切り離されている。
sen.e: The Tanba plateau and the Hira mountain region are separated by the Hanaore fault.
The Tanba plateau and the Hira mountain region are separated by the Hanaore fault.
The Tanba plateau and the Hira mountain region are separated by the Hanaore fault.

sen.j: このため、比叡山地、あるいは比叡醍醐山地に属するとされる。
sen.e: For this reason, it is considered to belong to the Hiei mountain region, or the Hiei Daigo mountain region.
For this reason, it is considered to belong to the Hiei mountain region, or the Hiei Daigo mountain region.
For this reason, it is considered to belong to the Hiei mountain region, or the Hiei Daigo mountain region.

sen.j: テレビ放送所
sen.e: Television Broadcast Towers
Television Broadcast Towers
Television Broadcast Towers

sen.j: 京都市左京区の側には、京都府をエリアとするテレビ局の親局が設置されている。
sen.e: On the Kyoto side, there are television stations that service the Kyoto Prefecture area.
On the side of Sakyo Ward of Kyoto City, there are television stations that service the Kyoto Prefecture area.
sen.cmt: On the Kyoto side→On the side of Sakyo Ward of Kyoto City
sen.e: On the side of Sakyo Ward of Kyoto City, there are television stations that service the Kyoto Prefecture area.

sen.j: 滋賀県側に極力電波が漏れないよう、アンテナにはアンテナ指向性が設けられている。
sen.e: On the Shiga Prefecture side, the antennae have directional capability to prevent the signal from leaking.
The antennae have directional capabilities to prevent the signal from leaking to the Shiga Prefecture side.
sen.cmt: directional capability→directional capabilities 滋賀県側に、は電波が漏れないように、に掛かっているので、文末に移動。
sen.e: The antennae have directional capabilities to prevent the signal from leaking to the Shiga Prefecture side.

sen.e: Began broadcasting on April 1, 2005.

sen.j: NHK大阪放送局NHK教育テレビジョン、MBS毎日放送、ABC朝日放送、KTV関西テレビ放送、ytv讀賣テレビ放送については、デジタル・アナログとも、生駒山からの電波を直接受信して視聴する。
sen.e: NHK Osaka, NHK Educational Television, MBS Mainichi Broadcasting, ABC Asahi Broadcasting, KTV Kansai TV, and ytv Yomiuri TV signals can be received directly from Mt. Ikoma.

NHK Osaka, NHK Educational Television, MBS Mainichi Broadcasting, ABC Asahi Broadcasting, KTV Kansai TV, and ytv Yomiuri TV signals can be received directly from Mt. Ikoma (both digital and analog broadcasting).

NHK Osaka, NHK Educational Television, MBS Mainichi Broadcasting, ABC Asahi Broadcasting, KTV Kansai TV, and ytv Yomiuri TV signals can be received directly from Mt. Ikoma (both digital and analog broadcasting).

sen.j: NHK総合についても、生駒山送出のNHK大阪総合を見るという世帯も少なくない。
sen.e: There are also many households that watch NHK Sogo from the Osaka broadcast on Mt. Ikoma.
